def: To make suffering or a problem less severe.
ex: The new medicine will help alleviate your back pain.

def: Open to more than one interpretation; not having one obvious meaning.
ex: His reply to my question was somewhat ambiguous.
It is essential to keep all your records in a safe place.
The bird has a conspicuous red head.
She was reluctant to admit she was wrong.

def: Satisfactory or acceptable in quality or quantity.
ex: This office is perfectly adequate for my needs.

def: Involving many carefully arranged parts or details.
ex: They made elaborate preparations for the wedding.

def: Full of incessant or frantic activity.
ex: Life in the city is extremely hectic.

def: To form an idea of the amount, number, or value of something.
ex: We need to evaluate the success of the campaign.
Sugar is ubiquitous in processed foods.
That is a plausible explanation for the incident.
The movie was released simultaneously in theaters and online.

def: Possible to do easily or conveniently.
ex: It is not economically feasible to run the project.

def: Accept or admit the existence or truth of.
ex: They acknowledged that the decision was a mistake.

def: Showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise.
ex: He was meticulous about keeping his desk clean.
